info.description: The helpCase service enables applications to create cases, access case data, and link cases to external records outside of Workday.
info.title: helpCase

tags.name: attachments
tags.description: Provides the ability to upload an attachment when creating a case.

tags.name: caseSuggestions
tags.description: Provides the ability to retrieve a list of suggestions based on case type.

tags.name: caseTypes
tags.description: Provides the ability to retrieve a list of case types that a worker has access to.

tags.name: cases
tags.description: Provides the ability to get and add cases for workers.

tags.name: configuration
tags.description: Provides the ability to retrieve tenant setup configurations related to Help Case Management.

tags.name: externalCreators
tags.description: The External Creators service enables applications to view and manage external \~case\~ contact details, such as email address and name.

tags.name: externalRecords
tags.description: Provides the ability to add and delete external records that you can link to Help cases. These REST APIs are secured to the Help External Records domain.

tags.name: serviceCategories
tags.description: Provides the ability to retrieve all parent service categories.

tags.name: Prompt Values
tags.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service.

put.summary: Deletes an existing link instance between an external record and case.
put.description: Deletes an existing link instance between an external record and case with the specified ID and the specified data in the request body. Secured by: Help External Records+TG Scope: Help

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Updating resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A2036 | You must enable external record linking in the Edit Tenant Setup - Help task.
A2061 | The defined external records is not linked to a Help \~case\~.
A2086 | You must specify a Help \~case\~ to add or delete a link to an external record.

get.summary: Retrieves a service category with the specified ID.
get.description: Retrieves a service category with the specified ID. Details include: name, description, case types, and child categories. Secured by: Manage: Case Create on Behalf Of+TG, Self Service: Help Case Management+TG Scope: Help

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Updates an existing resolved case instance
post.description: Updates an existing resolved case instance with the specified ID. Replaces the existing instance with the specified data in the request body Secured by: Process: Help Cases+TG, Self Service: Help Case Management+TG Scope: Help

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A2424 | Reopen reason cannot be blank. To reopen a \~case\~, please provide a reopen reason.
A2424 | Reopen reason cannot be blank. To reopen a \~case\~, please provide a reopen reason.
A2425 | To add a \~case\~ reopen reason to a \~case\~, you must enable the Enable \~Case\~ Owners to Reopen \~Cases\~ setting in the Edit Tenant Setup - Help task.
A2426 | You can’t add a \~case\~ reopen reason to a \~case\~ that is not in a resolved status.
A2427 | You can’t reopen the resolved \~case\~ unless you’re the \~case\~ owner.
A2428 | Specify a valid value for the \~case\~ reopen reason. You can’t add both rich text and plain text in the same reopen reason.
A2429 | To run this web service, you must activate Workday Help. Access the Innovation Services Opt-in and task to activate it in the People Experience section of the Available Services.
A2508 | You can't reopen a \~case\~ that is closed for more than 7 days.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of comment timeline items for a case.
get.description: Retrieves timeline items for a case. Comment timeline items include comments and associated attachments. Action timeline items include an action with an action text. Creation timeline items include a description, associated attachments, and a questionnaire answer if applicable. Secured by: REST API Public Contains attachment(s)

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a comment timeline item for a \~case\~ with the specified comment timeline ID.
get.description: Retrieves a comment timeline item for a \~case\~ with the specified comment timeline ID. Comment timeline items include comments and associated attachments. Secured by: Help Case Data+TG, Self Service: Help Case Management+TG Scope: Help Contains attachment(s)

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of suggestions based on case type.
get.description: Each case type can have different suggestions. Suggestions include: Knowledge Base articles, tasks, external links, and learning content. Secured by: Manage: Case Create on Behalf Of+TG, Self Service: Help Case Management+TG Scope: Help

parameters.name: caseType
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the case type to retrieve suggestions for. You can use GET /helpCase/caseTypes/view to retrieve a list of case types and their IDs.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves tenant setup configurations related to Help Case Management.
get.description: Retrieves configuration details including: confidential case message, file configurations, and maximum number of attachments. Secured by: REST API Public

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of external contact details.
get.description: Retrieves a collection of external contact details. Contact details include an email address and a name, if applicable. Blocked contacts can't create \~cases\~. Secured by: Help Case External Contacts+TG Scope: Help

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email address that identifies the external \~case\~ contact.

parameters.name: hideBlockedCreators
parameters.description: If true, blocked contacts are excluded from the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A609 | Invalid email. Enter a valid email address (example@email.com)
A1675 | The field Email is required and must have a value.
A1676 | This email address already exists. Enter a different email address.

post.description: Creates an instance for an external \~case\~ contact with the specified data. In the request body, specify at lease these required fields: Email. Secured by: Help Case External Contacts+TG Scope: Help

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A609 | Invalid email. Enter a valid email address (example@email.com)
A1675 | The field Email is required and must have a value.
A1676 | This email address already exists. Enter a different email address.

get.description: Get all sources for External Records

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

get.summary: Retrieves a comment timeline item for a case with the specified timeline ID.
get.description: Retrieves a timeline item for a case with the specified timeline ID. Comment timeline items include comments and associated attachments. Action timeline items include an action with an action text. Creation timeline items include a description, associated attachments and a questionnaire answer if applicable. Secured by: REST API Public Contains attachment(s)

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of cases that the user is secured to view.
get.description: Retrieves a list of case details that the user is secured to view. Case details include: title, detailed message, case ID, status, creation date, case link, assignee, confidential, about, by, for, type, and serviceTeam. Secured by: Help Case Data+TG, Self Service: Help Case Management+TG Scope: Help

parameters.name: desc
parameters.description: If true, sorts results in descending order.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Retrieves cases with the assigned label(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: myCases
parameters.description: Retrieves cases owned by the processing user.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: openCases
parameters.description: Retrieves open cases and cases that were resolved or canceled less than 7 days ago.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to sort results by. The default is creationDate. Note: Currently supports creationDate only.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Retrieves cases with the specified status(es).

parameters.name: substatus
parameters.description: Retrieves cases with the specified substatus(es).

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.description: Creates a single case instance with the specified data. In the request body, specify at least these required fields: caseType {id}, caseTitle {text}. You can add attachments by first calling the attachment API to get an attachments ID, and then including this ID in the Create Case request. You can also embed attachment details in the Create Case request. You can only include attachment types that are configured on the tenant. You can use GET /helpCase/configuration to determine which attachment types are supported. Secured by: Manage: Case Create on Behalf Of+TG, Self Service: Help Case Management+TG Scope: Help Contains attachment(s)

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1292 | Help isn't activated. Access the Innovation Services Opt-In task to activate it in the People Experience section of Available Services.
A1305 | Select a valid \~case\~ type.
A1306 | The questionnaireHolder value is invalid.
A1307 | You can only attach files that you own.
A1308 | You don't have access to the Create About field.
A1309 | 1 or more attachments are invalid.
A1311 | You can't attach more than [attachment limit] files to a submission.
A1312 | Enter a \~case\~ title with 140 characters or fewer.
A1314 | Select a valid \~worker\~ for the Create About field.
A1316 | You don't have access to the Create For field.
A1317 | The \~case\~ and the \~Case\~ Questionnaire must have the same \~case\~ type.
A1318 | An attachment can contain an ID or a file but not both.
A1323 | Select a valid \~worker\~ for the Create For field.
A1325 | You can't create a \~case\~ for an external \~case\~ type.
A1327 | You can only submit a questionnaire that you completed yourself.
A1328 | You’re the \~case\~ owner. If this \~case\~ is about you, leave this field blank. If it’s about a different \~worker\~, enter their name.
A1329 | This \~case\~ must include a questionnaire response.
A1330 | Select attachment reference IDs that aren't already linked to \~cases\~.
A1331 | Select a \~Case\~ Type.
A1332 | Select different \~workers\~ for the Create For and About fields.
A1333 | Enter a \~case\~ title.
A1335 | The selected \~case\~ type should include a questionnaire response.
A1437 | You can't create a \~case\~ for an Integration System User.
A1664 | You do not have access to the forExternalCreator field.
A1665 | You cannot create a \~case\~ for a blocked external creator.
A1666 | You cannot enter values for both the forWorker field and the forExternalCreator field. Remove the value from one of these fields.
A1754 | You have submitted more than one answer for a single select multiple choice question.
A1755 | You have selected an invalid answer choice.
A1756 | This questionnaire has already been submitted. You can’t submit it again.
A1756 | This questionnaire has already been submitted. You can’t submit it again.
A1757 | This questionnaire is now closed. You can no longer submit new responses or change your existing responses.
A1758 | You cannot submit answers to branching questions without answers for parent questions.
A1759 | All answers you submit must match the expected format for that question type.
A1761 | All answered questions must be questions from the associated questionnaire.
A1764 | You must answer all required questions.
A1765 | You have submitted more multiple choice answers than is allowed for a question.
A1781 | Could not create a \~case\~ for the contact.
A2576 | Context Instance provided needs to be accessibile by the UI task provided.
A2577 | You need to provide an UI task for the context instance.
A2578 | The Element Content provided is not available in the UI task provided.
A2579 | You do not have access to the UI task provided.

get.summary: Retrieves an internal note timeline item for a \~case\~ with the specified internal note timeline ID.
get.description: Retrieves an internal note timeline item for a \~case\~ with the specified internal note timeline ID. Internal note timeline items include notes, associated attachments, and tagged persons. Secured by: Help Case Internal Notes+TG Scope: Help Contains attachment(s)

parameters.name: ID

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Deleting resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1373 | Only a note or note attachment can be deleted.
A1378 | Only the owner can delete this note.

parameters.name: ID

parameters.name: subresourceID

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Updating resource.

Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1367 | Only the owner can edit this note.
A1371 | Request must contain a \~Case\~ note.
A2603 | Notes with a tagged \~worker\~ can't be updated.
A2604 | Specify a valid note. Notes must contain alphanumeric characters.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

A2403 | [errors]

get.summary: Retrieves a list of case types that a worker has access to.
get.description: Retrieves a list of case types that the specified worker has access to. When you don't specify a worker, retrieves a list of case types that the processing worker has access to. Secured by: Manage: Case Create on Behalf Of+TG, Self Service: Help Case Management+TG Scope: Help

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: The worker to use to determine access to case types.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves all parent service categories. Details include: name, description, case types, and child service categories. Only returns case types within each service category that the processing worker has access to. Secured by: Manage: Case Create on Behalf Of+TG, Self Service: Help Case Management+TG Scope: Help

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The name to search for. Use this parameter to return only: service categories with a name that matches or is similar to this string; service categories that have child categories with names that match or are similar to this string; and case types with names or descriptions that are similar to this string. The default value is empty.

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: The ID of an alternate worker to use instead of the processing worker when determining access to case types. The default value is empty.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves tenant setup configurations related to Help Case Management.
get.description: Retrieves configuration details including: confidential case message, file configurations, and maximum number of attachments. Secured by: REST API Public

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Creates and links external records to a Help case.
post.description: Creates a single external record instance and links it to a Help case with the specified data. In the request body, specify at least these required fields: [name, href, source:id, and case:id] Secured by: Help External Records+TG Scope: Help

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A2036 | You must enable external record linking in the Edit Tenant Setup - Help task.
A2037 | You must define an external record name to link external records to a Help \~case\~.
A2038 | Your external system must have an active link source and access to the target Help \~case\~.
A2039 | The defined external record is already linked to a Help \~case\~.
A2040 | You must define the href to link external records to a Help \~case\~.
A2041 | You cannot link more than [number] external records to a Help \~case\~.
A2051 | The defined external record name exceeds the [limit] character limit.
A2086 | You must specify a Help \~case\~ to add or delete a link to an external record.
A2093 | The external record href must begin with http:// or https://

code.description: The code that corresponds to the error message. Use the error code to drive programmatic error-handling behavior. Don't use error message strings for this purpose because they are subject to change

field.description: The field related to the error

path.description: The path of the field related to the error

items.description: This object represents the possible facets for this resource

facetParameter.description: The alias used to select the facet

count.description: The number of instances returned by this facet

description.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
